Name: Abatement Appeals Board
Purpose: Hears appeals against orders of abatement, which are issued when a building code violation is not fixed. Members belong to the Building Inspection Commission.

Name: Access Appeals Commission
Purpose: Conducts hearings on DBI's interpretations of disability access regulations and enforcement.

Name: Assessment Appeals Board # 1
Purpose: Hears tax assessment appeals regardless of value, type, or location.

Name: Assessment Appeals Board # 2
Purpose: One of two boards that hear tax assessment appeals on all residential property of four units or less and property assessed at less than $50 million.

Name: Assessment Appeals Board # 3
Purpose: One of two boards that hear tax assessment appeals on all residential property of four units or less and property assessed at less than $50 million.

Name: Board of Appeals
Purpose: Hears and decides appeals of decisions made by various city departments, commissions, and officers in regard to permits, licenses, and other use entitlements.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Planning Department, multiple other agencies

Name: Relocation Appeals Board
Purpose: Hears appeals from residents whose homes or businesses are displaced by city building projects and who are dissatisfied with the terms of a relocation package.
City Affiliation: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development (MOHCD)

Name: Arts Commission
Purpose: Approves designs for all public structures and public works of art, maintains works of art owned by the city, and controls arts expenditures made by the Board of Supervisors.

Name: Asian Art Commission
Purpose: Determines policy for and oversees the administration of the Asian Art Museum of San Francisco.

Name: Entertainment Commission
Purpose: Oversees the planning, permitting, and regulation of events and venues in San Francisco.

Name: Film Commission
Purpose: Develops and promotes opportunities for filmmaking and related activities in San Francisco.
City Affiliation: Office of Economic and Workforce Development (OEWD)

Name: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco Board of Trustees
Purpose: Oversees the de Young Museum and the Palace of the Legion of Honor.
City Affiliation: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco

Name: Historic Preservation Commission
Purpose: Advises the city on historic preservation matters, including the approval, disapproval, or modification of landmark designations and historic district designations.

Name: Library Commission
Purpose: Sets policy and oversees the library budget for the San Francisco Public Library system.

Name: War Memorial and Performing Arts Center Board of Trustees
Purpose: Governs the War Memorial and Performing Arts Center, a city department consisting of the War Memorial Opera House, Veterans Building (Herbst Theater and Green Room), Davies Symphony Hall, Zellerbach Rehearsal Hall, Memorial Court, and adjacent grounds.
City Affiliation: San Francisco War Memorial & Performing Arts Center

Name: Small Business Commission
Purpose: Analyzes how laws can affect and further the interests of small businesses.
City Affiliation: Office of Economic and Workforce Development (OEWD)

Name: Treasure Island Development Authority
Purpose: Guides economic development of Treasure Island and administers municipal services to Treasure Island and Yerba Buena Island.

Name: Workforce Investment San Francisco Board
Purpose: Oversees San Francisco's workforce development strategies and receives and manages the City's workforce funding through the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA).
City Affiliation: Office of Economic and Workforce Development (OEWD)

Name: Elections Commission
Purpose: Sets general policy for the Department of Elections and approves policies and procedures for each election.

Name: Redistricting Task Force
Purpose: Reconfigures the districts for the Board of Supervisors following each decennial federal census.

Name: Commission on the Environment
Purpose: Sets policy for the Department of the Environment and advises the Mayor and Board of Supervisors on environmental matters.

Name: Citizens' General Obligation Bond Oversight Committee
Purpose: Oversees general obligation bond programs, ensuring public facilities are built to the highest standards and that funds are spent in accordance with voter authorization.
Appointed By: Mayor, BoS, Controller, Civil Grand Jury

Name: Ethics Commission
Purpose: Enforces laws related to campaign finance, governmental ethics, conflicts of interest, and reporting by lobbyists, permit consultants, and major developers.
Appointed By: Mayor, BoS, City Attorney, D.A., Assessor

Name: Civil Service Commission
Purpose: Oversees the city's merit system to make sure the city hires and promotes workers fairly.

Name: Retiree Health Care Trust Fund Board
Purpose: Oversees the city's contribution to the health care premiums of its retirees and their survivors.

Name: Retirement Board
Purpose: Oversees administration, pension fund investment, member benefits, and actuarial funding of the city employees' retirement plan.

Name: Homelessness Oversight Commission
Purpose: Oversees the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH). Approves budgets, establishes departmental performance standards, conducts audits of service delivery, and holds hearings.
City Affiliation: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH)

Name: Residential Rent Stabilization and Arbitration Board
Purpose: Conducts rent arbitrations and mediations, investigates wrongful evictions, and provides information on the Rent Ordinance.

Name: Children and Families Commission
Purpose: Oversees the local distribution of Prop 10 funds, which use monies from a tobacco tax to support statewide education and outreach programs for young children and their families. (Formerly First 5 San Francisco.)
Appointed By: BoS, DPH, Human Services Agency, Dept of Children, Youth, and Their Families
City Affiliation: San Francisco Department of Early Childhood

Name: Disability and Aging Services Commission
Purpose: Oversees the Department of Disability and Aging Services (DAS) and acts on DAS staff recommendations to fund programs that promote health, safety, and independence for older people and adults with disabilities.
City Affiliation: Department of Disability and Aging Services (DAS)

Name: Human Services Commission
Purpose: Oversees the Department of Benefits and Family Support (part of the Human Services Agency) by formulating, evaluating, and approving policies for city social service programs.

Name: Recreation and Park Commission
Purpose: Establishes policies for the Recreation and Park Department.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Recreation and Park Department

Name: Board of Examiners
Purpose: Determines whether new construction methods and materials comply with safety standards established by the San Francisco Construction Codes.

Name: Building Inspection Commission
Purpose: Manages the Department of Building Inspection and oversees enforcement of the city's building codes.

Name: Planning Commission
Purpose: Maintains the San Francisco General Plan and approves all permits and licenses subject to the Planning Code.

Name: Health Commission
Purpose: In coordination with the Department of Public Health (DPH), oversees the city hospitals and emergency medical services.

Name: Health Service Board
Purpose: Administers health plans, reviews costs, and sets policies for the San Francisco Health Service System (SFHSS), which provides medical benefits to current and retired city employees.

Name: Fire Commission
Purpose: Oversees the Fire Department, prescribing and enforcing regulations and reviewing Fire Department personnel matters.

Name: Police Commission
Purpose: Oversees and makes policy for the Police Department and the Department of Police Accountability, investigates citizen complaints of police misconduct, and adjudicates police discipline cases.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Police Department (SFPD), Department of Police Accountability

Name: Sheriff's Department Oversight Board
Purpose: Appoints and evaluates the work of the Sheriff's Office of Inspector General (OIG), recommends custodial and patrol best practices, and reports on Sheriff's Department operations to the Board of Supervisors.

Name: Public Works Commission
Purpose: Sets policy for the Department of Public Works, which is responsible for building and maintaining city-owned facilities, maintaining the public right of way, and planting street trees.

Name: Sanitation and Streets Commission
Purpose: Holds public hearings and recommends policies to DPW regarding sanitation standards and protocols, and maintenance of the public right of way. Originally established to oversee the Sanitation and Streets department, which no longer exists.

Name: Commission on the Status of Women
Purpose: Recommends policies for and advocates on behalf of women and girls to reduce domestic violence, sexual harassment, and employment discrimination.
City Affiliation: Department on the Status of Women

Name: Human Rights Commission
Purpose: Investigates and mediates complaints of unlawful discrimination in public contracting, employment, housing, and public accommodations.

Name: Committee on Information Technology
Purpose: Develops and approves information and communication technology (ICT) plans, budgets, and projects for all city departments.
Appointed By: BoS, Controller, City Admin, other city depts.

Name: Airport Commission
Purpose: Oversees San Francisco International Airport (SFO) Airport and establishes policies by which SFO operates.

Name: Municipal Transportation Agency Board of Directors
Purpose: Establishes policies that govern the Municipal Railway (MUNI), traffic-related changes, parking enforcement, the taxicab industry, and city-owned parking facilities.

Name: Port Commission
Purpose: Oversees the Port of San Francisco, which operates, maintains, manages, and regulates the port area of San Francisco, a 7.5-mile stretch of waterfront adjacent to San Francisco Bay.

Name: Public Utilities Commission
Purpose: Provides operational oversight over rates and charges for service, approval of contracts, and organizational policy.

Name: Refuse Rate Board
Purpose: Reviews the costs and operations of the city's refuse collectors and adopts rate orders.
City Affiliation: Office of the Refuse Rates Administrator (Controller's Office)

Name: Residential Users Appeal Board
Purpose: Reviews the determination of the wastewater volume discharged to the city's sewer system for the purpose of assessing the user's sewer service charges.

Name: Juvenile Probation Commission
Purpose: Reviews policies and procedures of the Juvenile Probation Department to ensure that the department promotes the safety and welfare of juveniles entering the juvenile justice system, and follows state and court mandates for protection of juveniles.
